question: What would the night sky look like if all stars were the same size as the Sun?

steps.content: What would the night sky look like if all stars were the same size as the Sun?
Plan: 1) Search for information on how the size of stars affects their visibility and brightness. 2) Consider the hypothetical scenario where all stars are the size of the Sun. 3) Return the answer.
Searching for information on star sizes, brightness, and visibility in the night sky.
Stars vary greatly in size and brightness. If all stars were the size of the Sun, many more stars would be visible to the naked eye, and the night sky would be significantly brighter.

If all stars were the same size as the Sun, the night sky would appear much brighter, with many more visible stars. The overall brightness and number of visible stars would depend on their distance from Earth.

true_answer: If all stars were the same size as the Sun, the night sky would appear much brighter, with many more visible stars. The overall brightness and number of visible stars would depend on their distance from Earth.
